title: Finance Intern 2024/25
content:
Virtu is an industry-leading financial technology firm that operates both proprietary trading and client-facing businesses in the global financial marketplace. Our cutting edge, proprietary technology is core to everything we do. We trade in over 35 countries, across 235 financial exchanges and over 25% of retail order flow in the United States is serviced by Virtu. 
Our culture combines the creativity of a fast paced start up, with the stability of a disciplined financial services firm. We are a flat organization and encourage our people to innovate and lean on their teammates for support and collaboration. We have fun, work hard and strive to be virtuous in all we do. 
 

Finance Internship

Location: Dublin, Ireland. The role is expected to involve some time in Virtu’s office in One North Dock, 91/92 North Wall Quay, Dublin 1 as well as remote work from home.
Dates: June 2024 – June/July 2025 (minimum 6 months, with some flexibility if needed).
Training: Ongoing training throughout the duration.
Remuneration: EUR 30K per annum.

Our finance team are responsible for all aspects of financial control, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash management, GL maintenance, management accounts, audits & financial statements, tax compliance, regulatory reporting and finance systems automation and integration.
As an intern, you will be assigned a dedicated mentor, who, along with the wider finance team will ensure you are extensively trained and professionally developed so that you can meaningfully support our experienced team with a variety of day-to-day finance tasks, as well as project work.  While we expect that there will be a concentration in areas such as accounts payable, accruals, cash management and audits, we will ensure that you are afforded exposure to all aspects of our core processes and systems and gain an understanding of all elements of the group’s trial balance. 
After applicants pass an initial resume screening, we will contact you to arrange online aptitude tests, and interviews for successful candidates.
REQUIREMENTS

Excellent interpersonal skills and team player
Strong academic background in Accounting / Finance / Business courses
Strong analytical and detail-oriented aptitude; a high degree of accuracy is required


BENEFITS

Daily catered lunches from a range of restaurants and cafés across Dublin.
A fully stocked kitchen, including an extensive range of supplements, beverages and treats.
On-site barber / hairdresser, monthly basis / bi-monthly basis.
On-site gym, fully refurbished in 2023 and twice weekly group gym sessions directed by a personal trainer.
Casual dress code and flat organisational structure.
Potential to work from home on set days (once suitably trained to do so) and work balance options to accommodate commitments outside work.
Other benefits and amenities include: weekly on-site laundry service, organised after-work football, office pool table and more.

We looking forward to meeting you! 
Virtu Financial is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, welcoming you for who you are and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
